title: Grasp of the undying is so bad that Darius doesn't even use it

embed.description: LoL Statistics, Builds, Runes, Masteries, Skill Orders, Counters and Matchups for Darius when played Top. Statistics include Darius's Win Rate, Play Rate and Ban Rate. Counters include who Darius Top is Strong or Weak Against.

body:
And he's basicly someone who i'd consider an abuser of it, seeing that his bleed can keep him in combat near permenantly no matter what, guaranteeing far more, and far easier procs than pretty much anyone else, even usually building a decent amount of hp to take potential advantage of it.

If this doesn't say that Grasp is in a horrible state, i don't know what does.

Play like a bitch.

Rule number one for tanks against darius: you dont win lane, you just have to try not to horribly lose lane and feed.

If darius is smart, he runs the new fervor into tank matchups, and then you feel true pain. If he takes CoC you can better farm and be a wee bit more aggressive.

Ideally you have a bruiser or carry jungler since your team has you for a tank, darius struggles against ganks from damage oriented champs.

Sigh...this is why I wish I could just ban Darius. 

The other day I played against a full AD (Cleaver, mallet, deaths dance) Darius with crit runes in top lane. Great reminder in why I hate fighting him since I can't even get close enough to soak exp without him coming to pull me in, slow me, and then apply is freaking passive. 

He and Irelia are the top laners I hate the most.

First off, Darius is arguably the best top laner in solo q, so don't feel bad banning him.

I would advise against just giving him the lane, instead taking short trades that end at 4 bleed stacks, as he will kill you if he hits 5. You also have to punish every q he doesn't connect the blade on.

Lastly, he can flash during the q wind-up, so if youre sitting on 4 stacks and he q's 3 miles away, flash out.

> [{quoted}](name=Candentis,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oRdKVNQL,comment-id=000000010000000000000002,timestamp=2016-12-15T23:27:42.322+0000)

> Lastly, he can flash during the q wind-up, so if youre sitting on 4 stacks and he q's 3 miles away, flash out.

One trick is to run into his circle to eat the handle instead of trying to run away. Many times, it will psych Darius out and you can just walk down or up to avoid the grab. Erratic movements like that will put the fight into your favor.

I honestly hate that counterplay to his Q because Darius normally wants to be close to you. Forcing yourself to get close just feels against the nature of the fight against him. 

I have to fight the instinct to run away every time. It's amazing how I can't fight that instinct for his Q.

So what should be done about it?

Just buff its raw numbers?

Turn it into a pure damage tool for tanky folks?

Turn it into a pure sustain tool for tanky folks?
Honestly I'd prefer pure sustain. What I like about it is that it helps me survive longer in top. It's not as good in teamfights, but that should be it's respective niche that separates it from CoTC.

No. It is in a shitty state. And CotC already got butchered for lane with the way its CD works now, but even then, it's still better than grasp, and that's a testament to how shit grasp is.

See it this way: Grasp was used by Champions like Darius, Mao and other tanky Top Laners before preseason as a standard version. Ever since Courage of the Collossus was released, numbers on Grasp weren't changed. How can something get into a shitty spot without its stats being touched at all? Right, the only way is that there is another option that has more benefits over the longrun. You're right, Courage was nerfed already, but it being _still_ the better option over Grasp just shows how strong the shield is that you get out of it.
